p: All travelers should be advised of the risks from excessive sun exposure. Exposure to ultraviolet light in sunlight raises the risks of sunburn, heatstroke, melanoma, and nonmelanoma skin cancers. Travelers should therefore be advised to use an appropriate sunscreen with an SPF of at least 30 and to reapply this regularly throughout the day, especially after swimming or other exercise. They should also avoid exposure to the sun between the hours of 11a.m. and 3p.m. Use of hats, sunglasses, and clothing when out in the sun at peak times should be encouraged [ 112]. This advice is especially important for the immunosuppressed traveler as all immunosuppressive treatments have the potential to increase the incidence of skin cancer [ 113].
